Class Input

java.lang.Object
  Input
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>
public class Input
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable, java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>

An iterator class to input specific data types from an input stream without throwing any exceptions. If there are any errors during use of the iterator then a message is output to the standard output and the program terminates.

This is just a simple wrapper around Scanner that implements a subset of the Scanner public interface.

This class is useful for people new to Java since it allows them to write programs using input without having to fully understand the read / parse / handle exceptions model of the standard Java classes and in particular Scanner. So once exceptions and object chaining are covered this class ought not to be used, it is definitely just an "early stepping stone" utility class for initial learning.

Version:
2004-12-16
Author:
Russel Winder

remove

public void remove()
This operation is required in order to conform to Iterator<String> but is not supported. Normally an UnsupportedOperationException would be thrown to indicate this situation but the whole point is not to throw exceptions so this is simply a "do nothing" method.

Specified by:
remove in interface java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>

public boolean hasNextChar()
NB This method currently has a mis-feature in that it returns false incorrectly when there is a single end-of-line left in the file.
